issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: Setting AcidUtils.setTransactionalTableScan in HiveInputFormat causes downstream errors

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: HiveInputFormat job conf object lifecycle is unclear or broken

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Vectorization checks for ACID table trigger for MM tables where they don't apply. Other places seem to set the setting for transactional case while most of the code seems to assume it implies full acid.
Overall, many places in the code use the settings directly or set the ACID flag without setting the ACID properties.
fields.summary: ACID properties usage in jobconf is ambiguous for MM tables

comments.body:
hive.acid.table.scan and 

TABLE_IS_TRANSACTIONAL = "transactional"; as in AcidUtils.isTablePropertyTransactional

 when set on Configuration were always meant for full acid and only full acid

The code running on the Grid uses these to know it's doing acid

 

I think is the part that got broken - it's now set where it shouldn't be
Hmm, it took a while to post an RB
[~ekoifman] well, to avoid future ambiguity I'm making sure it's named explicitly and that properties must always be set (which they were anyway in all but one place).

ATTACHMENT ID: 12908220 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
[~ekoifman] can you take a look  at this one? :)

I left some comments on RB.  Mostly, I think the change in 

TableScanDesc()  doesn't do the right thing.

 

Also, the test for full acid is sometimes called isAcidTable() and sometimes isFullAcidTable() - either is fine but I think it's confusing to have both.

Addressed RB feedback. 
This actually makes a bunch of additional changes, renaming these util methods for clarity; there's a lot of code that is for transactional tables (sometimes even explicitly saying in a comment that it wants "ACID or MM") but calls isAcidTable.
